para_sentences.para_0: At this point, you should be able to answer all of the following questions.
para_sentences.para_1: You should now be able to create and use tuples. You should be able to explain the difference between mutable types and immutable types, as well as use some techniques for mutating a list. Finally, you should be able to explain the difference between rebinding a variable and mutating the value that a variable refers to.
para_sentences.para_2: If you are unsure of any of these answers, take some time to review the course materials. Feel free to post questions in Piazza or Teams. Next week's lessons will be easier if you have invested in mastering this week's learning outcomes.
para_sentences.para_3: Check the Explorations and Task List in the Lesson 7 - Overview to review learning materials and make sure you have completed all required activities for this week.

ul_0: What is the difference between mutable types and immutable types?
How can we modify an existing list?
What does it mean that Python variables are object references?
What is the difference between rebinding a variable  and mutating the value that a variable refers to?
